pros: Confluence has been great for me!
cons: Low pay is something that is a con

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Wenatchee, WA
pros: they have a residency program for newer cna or cna that come from long term care to learn effectively. as a cna depending on the floor you end up you can get exposed to a lot of different thing and be tiered to do more with you license (in combination with a MA-R).
cons: um short staffing has lead a lot of newer cna to be training cna, cost of living is crazy so while wage is better. overall feels like we start newer cna at okay rate but it lead to staff that has been here 1-3 to make close to if not the same as them.

pros: Remote work and flexible schedule
cons: Salary compensation doesn't not meet others in the state for same position.

job_title: Staff Physical Therapist in Wenatchee, WA
pros: The team is very patient centered. One on one care is a priority.
cons: Keeping a full schedule is a priority to meet productivity

pros: Matching retirement, fair health insurance, decent PTO if you have been there awhile.
cons: Where to begin? NO respect for employees, especially from upper management. HR is a collection of arrogant individuals- especially at the top. HR will do all they can to not compensate you for your past experience. The organization was constantly adding another high paid managerial position and yet nothing ever improved. The department I was in was full of drama, back biting, and inefficiency. The final straw for me was having an employer tell me what was correct, and right for my own body.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Wenatchee, WA
pros: Great company, definitely works towards staff development
cons: Haven’t been here long enough to know

pros: Caring company with great team work.
cons: pay not very competitive, could do better.

pros:
Staff is great to work with
A very chill environment
cons:
Management doesn’t seem to be involved much in certain departments 
Nurses like to overstep and question reception work

job_title: Lead CT Technologist in Wenatchee, WA
pros: Good wages and opportunity for advancement. Friendly work environment.
cons: Work load stress, Administration has apparently no loyalty to staff to protect jobs, families during harsh Covid vaccine mandates that are proven not to work. Will not issue real meaningful health or religious exemptions.

review_title: Good place to work, job stability
job_title: Medical Records Specialist in Wenatchee, WA
pros: Competitive salary, generous PTO allowance, numerous employee perks. Friendly, helpful team members.
cons: Issues with immediate supervisor who played favorites and lacked people skills. Workload was not consistent or evenly shared. No opportunity to cross train.

job_title: IT Solutions Tech I in Wenatchee, WA
pros:
Colleagues
Holiday Pay
Lot's of downtime
Bob
Senior employees in IT were always willing to help and teach. DeRuwe!
cons: No growth whatsoever. Org talks a lot about wanting to be efficient and the need for employees to share ideas however when it comes down to it they do not care at all. Management is terrible. Was told word for word "If you want to move up in the company you're going to have to leave get experience and come back" that's exactly what I did, leave. No intentions of returning.

pros: Insurance benefits are pretty good
cons: Don't pay employees very well

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Wenatchee, WA
pros: Some fantastic employees there, that work very hard.
cons: Bullying is allowed, management does nothing about it. It is like a dark cloud over the valley.

job_title: Registered Nurse MSN in Wenatchee, WA
pros: Multiple locations, great patients, and lots of quality teamwork!
cons: Senior leadership is not as visible to more remote locations, so they may not have an adequate picture of staffing issues in each department.

job_title: Certified Ophthalmic Technician in Wenatchee, WA
pros: I love how hands on the position is. Co-workers are helpful, and management is really compassionate. They encourage growth and help you gain different levels of certification to increase your salary.
cons: You normally start as a float tech and rotate through multiple providers which can be very difficult.

pros:
* I like my coworkers.
* Supervisor is great.
* Location is great.
cons:
* HR doesn’t care about paying fair wages.
* Doesn’t feel like the Director cares about how to assist with CEU reimbursement.
* Some coworkers don’t pull their weight sometimes.

job_title: Certified Clinical Medical Assistant in Wenatchee, WA
pros: Taking care of patients and having good coworkers
cons: Pay is less than fast food workers make. No breaks. Never get a bonus no matter how hard you work. Employees who do barely any work make the same as the one who is doing their own work and helping others finish their work.. Senior leadership are selfish and greedy. They do not respect employees religions or bodily autonomy nor do they respect patients who aren't vaccinated and their choices.

pros: The coworkers are really wonderful
cons: There are layers of administration

review_title: Pay is low and training is lacking.
job_title: Certified Coding Specialist in Wenatchee, WA
pros: Work independently without being bothered much. Coding management is nice but too busy to help when issues arise.
cons: There isn't enough time for training and the pay is not great. The CEO and other high up management don't really care about their employees.

pros: Fair wages and benefits. Some good docs to work with.
cons:
Horrible HR, management. They only care about the bottom line.
They don’t want nurses to change departments or grow.

pros: Comfortable and supportive place to work
cons: Pay scale is based on rural compensation not cost of living in Wenatchee

job_title: RN Nurse Supervisor in Wenatchee, WA
pros: Benefits package, paid time off, love the location, good people mostly
cons: low pay for the little people, overworked, constant staffing issues

pros: The surrounding area is nice.
cons: Secretive management. All about the money. Can't maintain staffing, though there's a nursing school down the street. Deeply divided politically over the vaccine, encouraged by management and physicians. Unvaccinated treated poorly by other staff.

pros: Over the years I’ve worked in several different departments and my managers have always been fantastic. They work hard to make it a safe workplace for all.
cons: Pay may not be equal to the Westside but are ratios are better

review_title: Good culture, pay is lacking for COL
pros: Work life balance, great manager
cons: Wages are out of touch with reality. Local homes extremely expensive. Wages and cost of living don't match.

pros: Good pay, but nothing else
cons: High turnover, management doesn't care about you, and when they want to get rid of you they will make up reasons.

review_title: Compassionate organization, needs to improve internal communication
pros: Everyone truly cares about our patients and providing a high level of care.
cons: Lack of communication and coordination amongst the different departments

job_title: Food Service Worker in Wenatchee, WA
pros: Fun patients to meet and will like you more than the doctor
cons: Managers don't care about your schedule as long as it benefits them

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Wenatchee, WA
pros: Manager was willing to work with school schedule
cons: Some dr.s are rude and have the god complex. Even though they have high turnover they still work there. Work life balance depended on what department you work for.

pros: Staff is very friendly, and managers approachable. They want to listen to your feedback and keep you within Confluence.
cons: Interviews can be hard to get at times, due to a lot of competition.

review_title: An ok place to work, could be better
pros: Schedule is great. Monday-Friday 8am-5pm
cons: Lack of communication in certain departments, makes changes hard to follow

job_title: Clinical Laboratory Scientist in Wenatchee, WA
pros: The wages are fair for the cost of living.
cons: Stressful workplace where abusive behavior is tolerated.

pros: Good Benefits Like health insurance
cons: Work culture is not great

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Moses Lake, WA
pros: Job, patients, and a few receptionist
cons: Department staff, Management, lot of drama with people that should be minding there own business.

pros: Patient centered care. Good values and solid goals.
cons: Lack of communication. Very profit focused. Lack of work life balance. Lots of turn over.

job_title: President &Amp; Chief Executive Officer in Atlantic City, NJ
pros: Excellent career opportunities and business development capabilities
cons: Pay and payment from clients is substandard

job_title: Medical Social Work in Wenatchee, WA
pros: I don't know this part
cons: Good employee recognition, support, and pay

job_title: Solutions Tech II in Omak, WA
pros: Co workers were nice to work with
cons: Direct supervisor was bipolar when working with people under him

review_title: No longer the great institution it once was
job_title: Applications Analyst II in Wenatchee, WA
pros: Largest employer in the Chelan County. On-Site cafes and bistros. Get to know everyone in town.Yearly BBQ. Yearly Golf Tournament. And they will gladly never fire anyone no matter how terrible. Just show up and collect a check and you are good for your career.
cons: After the Doctors and Executives take their bonuses, and the Unions grab their small slice, nothing is left over for the regular workers. A cost of living raise is considered a true raise. Better off going to fast food as the employee discount on food covers only taxes and the food prices are double what they should be to begin with. You get to work with a lot of sub par employees because no one is ever let go.

review_title: Lots of talk not much support
pros:
Tangentially saving lives.
Beautiful Valley.
Some good people.
cons:
Poor management top to bottom.
Unequal distribution of work within same dapartment.
Some really horrible people.
Always looking for the cheap management promotion from within the company instead of bringing in qualified people.

job_title: Contact Center Specialist in Wenatchee, WA
pros: Some great managers, co-workers. Learned a lot about health care.
cons: Do not feel valued... Similar roles in other nearby facilities pay a substantial amount higher. There is also a high turnover due to low pay, and either direct management doesn't seem interested in advocating for fair compensation or upper management simply sees us as disposable.

pros: good benefits, good working conditions, competent doctors
cons: co-workers that gossip and waste time

review_title: Smallish company with opportunity for growth
pros:
Laid back environment
Small org allows for bigger role if desired/advancement
cons:
Professionalism across the organization is often lacking
large opportunity for growth sometimes results under qualified leadership/underperforming employees

pros: Confluence works hard to create a caring and safe environment .
cons: Given the circumstances of the pandemic, they are still providing strong Leadership.

pros: Good benefits, insurance, pay, job details
cons: Management was not open to change

pros: Excellent opportunity to achieve advancement in career
cons: Large influx of new employees and management with entry level experience and immaturity.

pros: Pay, location, benefits, training opportunities
cons: Leaders new to the organization not particularly welcome. Confluence prefers to promote from within

pros: Independence and wonderful co-working personnel
cons: Uncompetitive wages and absolutely horrible benefits

cons: Not much opportunity for career growth

cons: Not enough hours available in the telemetry room

cons: Management does not understand how busy staff is. Understaffed

cons: Management, benefits, understaffed and unappreciated. Lost concept of loyalty. Profits over patients mentality.
